name: II. Data Description and Preparation
content:
Data Description

The dataset (adv_Data.csv) typically includes the following features:

  • Time Dimension: Week/Month identifiers (temporal granularity is weekly).
  • Advertising Spend Variables: TV, Radio, Newspaper, Digital, etc. (continuous numerical variables).
  • Outcome Variable: Sales (continuous numerical).

Granularity: Weekly ad spends and corresponding sales values over a multi-period timeframe.

Variable Types:

  • Numerical – Advertising spends, Sales.
  • Categorical/Temporal – Time periods, campaign IDs (if included).

Data Preparation

Steps:

1. Data Cleaning – Handle missing values in ad spends or sales data; detect and treat outliers (e.g., unusually high spends).

2. Feature Engineering –

  • Create adstock-transformed variables (lagged cumulative effects with decay factor).
  • Create interaction terms between channels (e.g., TV × Digital).

3. Normalization/Scaling – Standardize spends for comparability across channels.

4.Train-Test Split – Divide dataset into training and validation sets to ensure unbiased model evaluation.
